name: dwc-data-package
title: Darwin Core Data Package
description: A data package containing Darwin Core related tables for molecular data.

schema.name: event
schema.title: Event
schema.description: An action, process, or set of circumstances occurring at a dcterms:Location during a period of time.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventDate
fields.title: Event Date
fields.description: A date or time interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: For gathering dwc:Events, this is the date-time when the gathering took place.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007)

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.title: Decimal Latitude
fields.description: A geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.title: Decimal Longitude
fields.description: A geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

schema.name: identification
schema.title: Identification
schema.description: A taxonomic determination (i.e., the assignment of dwc:Taxa to dwc:Organisms).

fields.name: identificationID
fields.title: Identification ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnNucleotideSequenceID
fields.title: Based On Nucleotide Sequence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideSequence based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: higherClassificationName
fields.title: Higher Classification Name
fields.description: A full scientific name at a higher rank than the taxonRank of dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: A higherClassificationName must have a corresponding higherClassificationRank.

fields.name: higherClassificationRank
fields.title: Higher Classification Rank
fields.description: A taxonomic rank of the higherClassificationName.
fields.comments: A higherClassificationRank must have a corresponding higherClassificationName.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Roptrocerus typographi (Gy√∂rfi, 1952)` (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

schema.name: molecular-protocol
schema.title: MolecularProtocol
schema.description: A protocol used to derive and identify a nucleotide sequence from a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: molecularProtocolID
fields.title: Molecular Protocol ID
fields.description: An identifier for a MolecularProtocol.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: target_gene
fields.title: target_gene
fields.description: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies.

fields.name: target_subfragment
fields.title: target_subfragment
fields.description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA.

fields.name: pcr_primer_forward
fields.title: pcr_primer_forward
fields.description: Forward PCR primer that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. If multiple multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction, there should be a full row for each of these linked to the same dwc:Occurrence. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters.

fields.name: pcr_primer_reverse
fields.title: pcr_primer_reverse
fields.description: Reverse PCR primer that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. If multiple multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction, there should be a full row for each of these linked to the same dwc:Occurrence. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters.

fields.name: pcr_primer_name_forward
fields.title: pcr_primer_name_forward
fields.description: Name of the forward PCR primer that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. If multiple multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction, there should be a full row for each of these linked to the same dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: pcr_primer_name_reverse
fields.title: pcr_primer_name_reverse
fields.description: Name of the reverse PCR primer that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. If multiple multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction, there should be a full row for each of these linked to the same dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: pcr_primer_reference
fields.title: pcr_primer_reference
fields.description: Reference for the PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment.

fields.name: sop
fields.title: sop
fields.description: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences.

fields.name: otu_db
fields.title: otu_db
fields.description: Reference database (i.e. sequences not generated as part of the current study) used to cluster new genomes in "species-level" OTUs, if any.

fields.name: lib_layout
fields.title: lib_layout
fields.description: Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads.

fields.name: otu_class_appr
fields.title: otu_class_appr
fields.description: Cutoffs and approach used when clustering new UViGs in "species-level" OTUs. Note that results from standard 95% ANI / 85% AF clustering should be provided alongside OTUS defined from another set of thresholds, even if the latter are the ones primarily used during the analysis.

fields.name: otu_seq_comp_appr
fields.title: otu_seq_comp_appr
fields.description: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing "species-level" OTUs.

fields.name: biotic_relationship
fields.title: biotic_relationship
fields.description: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object.

fields.name: env_medium
fields.title: env_medium
fields.description: In this field, report which environmental material or materials (pipe separated) immediately surrounded your sample or specimen prior to sampling, using one or more subclasses of ENVO‚Äôs environmental material class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a fish swimming in the upper 100 m of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: ocean water [ENVO:00002151]. Example: Annotating a duck on a pond consider: pond water [ENVO:00002228]|air ENVO_00002005. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html.

schema.name: nucleotide-analysis
schema.title: NucleotideAnalysis
schema.description: A link between a NucleotideSequence and a dwc:Event and a dwc:MaterialEntity from which it was derived, using a specified Protocol.

fields.name: nucleotideAnalysisID
fields.title: Nucleotide Analysis ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideAnalysis.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: molecularProtocolID
fields.title: Molecular Protocol ID
fields.description: An identifier for a MolecularProtocol.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: nucleotideSequenceID
fields.title: Nucleotide Sequence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideSequence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: readCount
fields.title: Read Count
fields.description: A number of reads for a NucleotideSequence in a NucleotideAnalysis.

fields.name: totalReadCount
fields.title: Total Read Count
fields.description: A total number of reads in a NucleotideAnalysis.

schema.name: nucleotide-sequence
schema.title: NucleotideSequence
schema.description: A digital representation of a nucleotide sequence.

fields.name: nucleotideSequenceID
fields.title: Nucleotide Sequence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideSequence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: nucleotideSequence
fields.title: Nucleotide Sequence
fields.description: A string representing nucleotide base pairs.
